Literature Review: The concept of overcriminalization has garnered significant attention in recent years, with scholars and practitioners from diverse backgrounds acknowledging its existence and implications. This literature review aims to provide an in-depth examination of six crucial issues surrounding overcriminalization, which are essential for resolving the problem. The six issues are: (1) the definition of the criminal law, (2) the meaning of overcriminalization, (3) the perceived harm caused by overcriminalization, (4) the distinction between de jure and de facto overcriminalization, (5) the normative criteria for addressing overcriminalization, and (6) the extent to which overcriminalization is a pressing concern in the penal system. By addressing these issues, this review seeks to provide a comprehensive understanding of the problem of overcriminalization and its implications for the criminal justice system.
